definition: Laozi and Zhuangzi (or Lao-tze and Chuang-tze), the founders of Daoism

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
variant of 莊|庄[zhuang1]
farmstead/village/manor/place of business/banker (in a gambling game)/grave or solemn/holdings of a landlord (in imperial China)
surname Zhuang

sentences.english: Can you imagine what I felt when I left Kao village?
sentences.chinese: 你能想象我离开高老庄时的心情吗？

sentences.english: Laozhuang metaphysics prevails, promote the development of Taoist theory.
sentences.chinese: 老庄玄学盛行，促进了道教理论的发展。

sentences.english: The full-length novel "Old Gao village" is in fact a fable.
sentences.chinese: 长篇小说《高老庄》实则是一个寓言。

sentences.english: The old Chuang just obliterated a wash turn of mouth, the blood again creature overflowed dyed ruddy.
sentences.chinese: 老庄刚刚擦净的嘴角，再一次被溢出来的鲜血染红。

definition: Zhuangzi (369-286 BC), Daoist author
Confucius and Mencius
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
scholar/Confucian
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Confucius
profound theory/philosophical theory of Wei and Jin 玄學|玄学 sect
Confucian study of ethics/study of Daoism/school for Daoism in Tang and Song times/Daoist magic/another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism
Yang Zhu (c. 440-360 BC), Chinese philosopher advocating ethical egoism
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
Buddhist doctrine/Buddhist studies
the true way
Zen Buddhism
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
the Daoist doctrine of inaction/let things take their own course/laissez-faire
Wuwei county in Chaohu 巢湖[Chao2 hu2], Anhui
